main event: On May 24, 1964, an object resembling a bright star was observed in Washington, D.C., exhibiting zig-zag maneuvers and changing colors.
interesting points: The observation occurred at 2:27 PM, with the object disappearing and reappearing multiple times., The sighting involved a secondhand report., The witness described the object as heading southeast at a very high altitude., The object was said to maneuver in a manner that was likened to a light cannon., The report indicated that the observation was cloudy at the time of the sighting.
witness description: one individual reported, with a secondhand account available
